children.name: resizeEnd
Example - subscribe to the "resizeEnd" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "resizeEnd" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the user releases the mouse after resizing a task.The event handler function context (available via the this keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: resize
Example - subscribe to the "resize" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "resize" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the user is resizing a task.The event handler function context (available via the this keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: resizeStart
Example - subscribe to the "resizeStart" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "resizeStart" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the user starts to resize a task.The event handler function context (available via the this keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: pdfExport
Example - subscribe to the "pdfExport" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "pdfExport" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the user clicks the "Export to PDF" toolbar button.

children.name: moveEnd
Example - subscribe to the "moveEnd" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "moveEnd" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the user stops moving a task.The event handler function context (available via the this keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: move
Example - subscribe to the "move" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "move" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the user is moving a task.The event handler function context (available via the this keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: moveStart
Example - subscribe to the "moveStart" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "moveStart" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the user starts to drag a task.The event handler function context (available via the this keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: navigate
Example -  subscribe to the "navigate" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "navigate" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the user changes the selected view of the Gantt.The event handler function context (available via the this keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: columnResize
Example - subscribe to the "columnResize" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "columnResize" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the user resizes a column.The event handler function context (available via the `this` keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: change
Example - subscribe to the "change" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "change" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the user selects a task in the Gantt.The event handler function context (available via the this keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: save
Example - subscribe to the "save" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "save" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when a task field is updated upon user interaction.The event handler function context (available via the this keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: cancel
Example - subscribe to the "cancel" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "cancel" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the user cancels tasks's cell editing by pressing the 'Esc' key.The event handler function context (available via the this keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: remove
Example - subscribe to the "remove" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "remove" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when a task or a dependency is about to be removed.The event handler function context (available via the `this` keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: edit
Example - subscribe to the "edit" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "edit" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the user starts task edit upon double click on a cell.The event handler function context (available via the `this` keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: add
Example - subscribe to the "add" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "add" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when a new task or a new dependency is about to be added.The event handler function context (available via the `this` keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: dataBound
Example - subscribe to the "dataBound" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "dataBound" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the widget is bound to data from its data source.The event handler function context (available via the this keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: dataBinding
Example - subscribe to the "dataBinding" after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "dataBinding" event during initialization

children.description: Fired before the widget binds to its data source.The event handler function context (available via the `this` keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: view
children.description: Gets or sets the current Gantt view.

children.name: setDependenciesDataSource
Example - set the dependencies data source

parameters.name: dataSource `kendo.data.GanttDependencyDataSource`
parameters.description: The dependencies data source to which the widget should be bound.

children.description: Sets the dependencies data source of the widget.

children.name: setDataSource
Example - set the tasks data source

parameters.name: dataSource `kendo.data.GanttDataSource`
parameters.description: The tasks data source to which the widget should be bound.

children.description: Sets the tasks data source of the widget.

children.name: select
Example - select the first table row.

parameters.name: row `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: A string, DOM element or jQuery object which represents the table row. A string is treated as a jQuery selector.

children.description: Gets or sets the table row which is selected.

children.name: saveAsPDF
children.description: Initiates the PDF export and returns a promise. Also triggers the [pdfExport](#events-pdfExport) event.> Calling this method may trip the built-in browser pop-up blocker. To avoid that, call this method as a response to an end-user action, e.g. a button click.

children.name: removeTask

parameters.name: task `String|kendo.data.GanttTask`
parameters.description: The task which should be removed. Also accepts a string which is the `uid` of the task which should be removed.

children.description: Removes the specified Gantt task.

children.name: removeDependency

parameters.name: dependency `String|kendo.data.GanttDependency`
parameters.description: The dependency which should be removed. Also accepts a string which is the `uid` of the dependency which should be removed.

children.description: Removes the specified Gantt dependency.

children.name: refreshDependencies
children.description: Renders all dependencies using the current data items.

children.name: refresh
children.description: Renders all tasks and dependencies using the current data items.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the widget for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> This method does not remove the widget element from DOM.

children.name: dataItem
Example - get the task data item to which the first table row is bound

parameters.name: row `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: A string, DOM element or jQuery object which represents the table row. A string is treated as a jQuery selector.

children.description: Returns the data item to which the specified table row from the TreeList is bound

children.name: clearSelection
Example - subscribe to the "dataBinding" event during initialization

children.description: Clears the currently selected task or dependency.

children.name: Example - remove a dependency from the dependencies data source
Example - add a dependency to the dependencies data source
Example - remove a Gantt task from the data source
Example - update multiple Gantt task fields with the update method
Example - update a Gantt task in the data source
Example - add a Gantt task to the data source
rowHeight
children.description: The height of the table rows. Numeric values are treated as pixels.

children.name: resources.field
children.description: The field of the gantt task which contains the assigned resource objects.

children.name: resources.dataTextField
Example - set the resource data text field

children.description: The field of the resource data item which represents the resource text.

children.name: resources.dataSource
Example - set the resource data source

children.description: The data source which contains resource data items.  Can be a JavaScript object which represents a valid data source configuration, a JavaScript array or an existing [kendo.data.DataSource](/api/javascript/data/datasource)instance.If the `dataSource` option is set to a JavaScript object or array the widget will initialize a new [kendo.data.DataSource](/api/javascript/data/datasource) instance using that value as data source configuration.If the `dataSource` option is an existing [kendo.data.DataSource](/api/javascript/data/datasource) instance the widget will use that instance and will **not** initialize a new one.

children.name: resources.dataColorField
Example - set the resource data color field

children.description: The field of the resource data item which contains the resource color.

children.name: resources.dataFormatField
Example - set the resource data format field

children.description: The field of the resource data item containing the format of the resource value, which could be assigned to a gantt task.The data item format value could be any valid [kendo format](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-format).

children.name: resources
children.description: The configuration of the gantt resource(s). A gantt resource is optional metadata that can be associatedwith a gantt task.

children.name: views.resizeTooltipFormat
children.description: The format used to display the start and end dates in the resize tooltip.

children.name: views.yearHeaderTemplate
children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) used to render the year slots in "year" view.

children.name: views.monthHeaderTemplate
children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) used to render the month slots in "month" and "year" views.

children.name: views.weekHeaderTemplate
children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) used to render the week slots in "week" and "month" views.

children.name: views.dayHeaderTemplate
children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) used to render the day slots in "day" and "week" views.

children.name: views.timeHeaderTemplate
children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) used to render the time slots in "day" view

children.name: views.slotSize
children.description: The size of the time slot headers. Values are treated as pixels.

children.name: views.selected
children.description: If set to `true` the view will be initially selected by the Gantt widget. The default selected view is "day".> If more than one view is selected then last of them will prevail.

children.name: views.type
children.description: The type of the view. The built-in views are: "day", "week", "month" and "year".

children.name: views
children.description: The views displayed by the Gantt and their configuration. The array items can be either objects specifying the view configuration or strings representing the view types (assuming default configuration).By default the Kendo UI Gantt widget displays "day", "week", and "month" views.

children.name: tooltip.visible
children.description: If set to `false` the gantt will not display the task tooltip. By default the task tooltip is displayed.

children.name: tooltip.template
Example - set the task tooltip template

children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) which renders the tooltip.The fields which can be used in the template are:* task - the gantt task, for which the template is shown

children.name: tooltip
children.description: The task tooltip configuration options.

children.name: toolbar.text
Example - set the text of the toolbar button

children.description: The text displayed by the command button. If not set the [name](#configuration-toolbar.name)` option would be used as the button text instead.

children.name: toolbar.template
Example - set the template as a string
Example - set the template as a function

children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) which renders the command. By default renders a button.

children.name: toolbar.name
Example - specify the name of the command

children.description: The name of the toolbar command. Either a built-in ("append" and "pdf") or custom. The `name` is reflected in one of the CSS classes, which is applied to the button - `k-gantt-name`.This class can be used to obtain reference to the button after Gantt initialization and attach click handlers.

children.name: toolbar
Example - configure the Gantt Toolbar as an array of commands
Example - configure the Gantt Toolbar template with a function
Example - configure the Gantt Toolbar as a string template

children.description: If a `String` value is assigned to the `toolbar` configuration option, it will be treated as a single string template for the whole Gantt Toolbar,and the string value will be passed as an argument to a [`kendo.template()`](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) function.If a `Function` value is assigned (it may be a kendo.template() function call or a generic function reference), then the return value of the function will be used to render the Gantt Toolbar contents.If an `Array` value is assigned, it will be treated as the list of commands displayed in the Gantt Toolbar. Commands can be custom or built-in ("append", "pdf").The "append" command adds a new task to the gantt.The "pdf" command exports the gantt in PDF format.

children.name: taskTemplate
children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) used to render the gantt tasks.The fields which can be used in the template are the [task fields](/api/javascript/data/gantttask)

children.name: showWorkHours
children.description: If set to `false`, the day view will show all hours of the day. By default the view displays only business hours.

children.name: showWorkDays
children.description: If set to `false`, Gantt views will show all days of the week. By default the views display only business days.

children.name: selectable
children.description: If set to `false` the user won't be able to select tasks in the Gantt. By default selection is enabled and triggers the [change event](#events-change).

children.name: resizable
children.description: If set to `true` allows users to resize columns by dragging their header borders. By default resizing is disabled.

children.name: pdf.title
children.description: Sets the title of the PDF file.

children.name: pdf.subject
children.description: Sets the subject of the PDF file.

children.name: pdf.proxyTarget
Example - open the generated document in a new window

children.description: A name or keyword indicating where to display the document returned from the proxy.If you want to display the document in a new window or iframe,the proxy should set the "Content-Disposition" header to `inline; filename="<fileName.pdf>"`.

children.name: pdf.proxyURL
Example - set the server proxy URL

children.description: The URL of the server side proxy which will stream the file to the end user.A proxy will be used when the browser isn't capable of saving files locally.Such browsers are IE version 9 and lower and Safari.The developer is responsible for implementing the server-side proxy.The proxy will receive a POST request with the following parameters in the request body:* contentType: The MIME type of the file* base64: The base-64 encoded file content* fileName: The file name, as requested by the caller.The proxy should return the decoded file with set "Content-Disposition" header.

children.name: pdf.paperSize
children.description: Specifies the paper size of the PDF document.The default "auto" means paper size is determined by content.> The size of the content in pixels will match the size of the output in points (1 pixel = 1/72 inch).Supported values:* A predefined size: "A4", "A3" etc* An array of two numbers specifying the width and height in points (1pt = 1/72in)* An array of two strings specifying the width and height in units.  Supported units are "mm", "cm", "in" and "pt".

children.name: pdf.margin.top
children.description: The top margin. Numbers are considered as "pt" units.

children.name: pdf.margin.right
children.description: The right margin. Numbers are considered as "pt" units.

children.name: pdf.margin.left
children.description: The left margin. Numbers are considered as "pt" units.

children.name: pdf.margin.bottom
children.description: The bottom margin. Numbers are considered as "pt" units.

children.name: pdf.margin
children.description: Specifies the margins of the page (numbers or strings with units). Supportedunits are "mm", "cm", "in" and "pt" (default).

children.name: pdf.landscape
children.description: Set to `true` to reverse the paper dimensions if needed such that width is the larger edge.

children.name: pdf.keywords
children.description: Specifies the keywords of the exported PDF file.

children.name: pdf.forceProxy
children.description: If set to true, the content will be forwarded to [proxyURL](#configuration-pdf.proxyURL) even if the browser supports saving files locally.

children.name: pdf.fileName
Example - set the default PDF file name

children.description: Specifies the file name of the exported PDF file.

children.name: pdf.date
children.description: The date when the PDF document is created. Defaults to `new Date()`.

children.name: pdf.creator
children.description: The creator of the PDF document.

children.name: pdf.avoidLinks
children.description: A flag indicating whether to produce actual hyperlinks in the exported PDF file.It's also possible to pass a CSS selector as argument. All matching links will be ignored.> Available in versions 2015.3.1020 and later

children.name: pdf.author
children.description: The author of the PDF document.

children.name: pdf
children.description: Configures the Kendo UI Gantt PDF export settings.

children.name: messages.views.year
children.description: The text similar to "Year" displayed as Gantt "year" view title.

children.name: messages.views.week
children.description: The text similar to "Week" displayed as Gantt "week" view title.

children.name: messages.views.start
children.description: The text similar to "Start" displayed in Gantt resize hint.

children.name: messages.views.month
children.description: The text similar to "Month" displayed as Gantt "month" view title.

children.name: messages.views.end
children.description: The text similar to "End" displayed in Gantt resize hint.

children.name: messages.views.day
children.description: The text similar to "Day" displayed as Gantt "day" view title.

children.name: messages.views
children.description: The configuration of the Gantt view messages. Use this option to customize or localize the Gantt view messages.

children.name: messages.save
children.description: The text similar to "Save" displayed in Gantt.

children.name: messages.editor.unitsHeader
children.description: The text similar to "Units" displayed in Gantt task editor.

children.name: messages.editor.title
children.description: The text similar to "Title" displayed in Gantt task editor.

children.name: messages.editor.start
children.description: The text similar to "Start" displayed in Gantt task editor.

children.name: messages.editor.resourcesHeader
children.description: The text similar to "Resources" displayed in Gantt task editor.

children.name: messages.editor.resourcesEditorTitle
children.description: The text similar to "Resources" displayed in Gantt task editor.

children.name: messages.editor.resources
children.description: The text similar to "Resources" displayed in Gantt task editor.

children.name: messages.editor.percentComplete
children.description: The text similar to "Complete" displayed in Gantt task editor.

children.name: messages.editor.end
children.description: The text similar to "End" displayed in Gantt task editor.

children.name: messages.editor.editorTitle
children.description: The text similar to "Task" displayed in Gantt task editor.

children.name: messages.editor.assignButton
children.description: The text similar to "Assign" displayed in Gantt task editor.

children.name: messages.editor
children.description: The configuration of the Gantt editor messages. Use this option to customize or localize the Gantt editor messages.

children.name: messages.destroy
children.description: The text similar to "Delete" displayed in Gantt.

children.name: messages.deleteTaskWindowTitle
children.description: The text similar to "Delete task" displayed in Gantt task delete dialog title.

children.name: messages.deleteTaskConfirmation
children.default: "Are you sure you want to delete this task?"
children.description: The text similar to "Are you sure you want to delete this task?" displayed in Gantt task delete dialog.

children.name: messages.deleteDependencyWindowTitle
children.description: The text similar to "Delete dependency" displayed in Gantt dependency delete dialog title.

children.name: messages.deleteDependencyConfirmation
children.default: "Are you sure you want to delete this dependency?"
children.description: The text similar to "Are you sure you want to delete this dependency?" displayed in Gantt dependency delete dialog.

children.name: messages.cancel
children.description: The text similar to "Cancel" displayed in Gantt.

children.name: messages.actions.pdf
children.description: The text of "Export to PDF" button of the Gantt toolbar.

children.name: messages.actions.insertBefore
children.description: The text similar to "Add above" displayed as Gantt "add above" buttons.

children.name: messages.actions.insertAfter
children.description: The text similar to "Add below" displayed as Gantt "add below" buttons.

children.name: messages.actions.append
children.description: The text similar to "Append" displayed as Gantt "append" buttons.

children.name: messages.actions.addChild
children.description: The text similar to "Add child" displayed as Gantt "add child" buttons.

children.name: messages.actions
children.description: The configuration of the Gantt action messages. Use this option to customize or localize the Gantt action messages.

children.name: messages
children.description: The configuration of the Gantt messages. Use this option to customize or localize the Gantt messages.

children.name: listWidth
children.description: The width of the task list. Numeric values are treated as pixels.

children.name: height
children.description: The height of the widget. Numeric values are treated as pixels.

children.name: snap
children.description: If set to true the Gantt will snap tasks to the nearest slot during dragging (resizing or moving). Set it to false to allow free moving and resizing of tasks.

children.name: hourSpan
children.description: The span of an hour slot.

children.name: workWeekEnd
children.description: The end of working week (index based).> The `workWeekEnd` option is supported when [showWorkDays](#configuration-showWorkDays) is `true`.

children.name: workWeekStart
children.description: The start of working week (index based).> The `workWeekEnd` option is supported when [showWorkDays](#configuration-showWorkDays) is `true`.

children.name: workDayEnd
children.description: Sets the end of the work day.

children.name: workDayStart
children.description: Sets the start of the work day.

children.name: navigatable
children.description: If set to `true` the user could navigate the widget using the keyboard. By default keyboard navigation is disabled.> Even when the keyboard navigation is disabled the user could delete selected tasks or dependencies with the `Del` key.

children.name: editable.template
Example - using MVVM in the popup editor template

children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) which renders the editor.The template should contain elements whose `name` HTML attributes are set as the editable fields. This is how the Gantt will knowwhich field to update. The other option is to use [MVVM](/framework/mvvm/overview) bindings in order to bind HTML elements to data item fields.> Use the `role` data attribute to initialize Kendo UI widgets in the template. Check [data attribute initialization](/data-attribute-initialization) for more info.

children.name: editable.confirmation
children.description: If set to `true` the Gantt will display a confirmation dialog when the user deletes a task or a dependency.

children.name: editable
children.description: If set to `false` the user won't be able to create, modify or delete tasks and dependencies.

children.name: dependencies
Example - set `dependencies` as an existing `kendo.data.GanttDependencyDataSource` instance
Example - set `dependencies` as a JavaScript array
Example - set `dependencies` as a JavaScript object

children.description: The data source of the widget which contains the dependencies. Can be a JavaScript object which represents a valid data source configuration, a JavaScript array or an existing [kendo.data.GanttDependencyDataSource](/api/javascript/data/ganttdependencydatasource)instance.If the `dependencies` option is set to a JavaScript object or array the widget will initialize a new [kendo.data.GanttDependencyDataSource](/api/javascript/data/ganttdependencydatasource) instance using that value as data source configuration.If the `dependencies` option is an existing [kendo.data.GanttDependencyDataSource](/api/javascript/data/ganttdependencydatasource) instance the widget will use that instance and will **not** initialize a new one.> The Kendo UI Gantt dependencies can be bound *only* to a `kendo.data.GanttDependencyDataSource`. An exception will be thrown if the `dataSource` option is set to a `kendo.data.DataSource` instance.

children.name: dataSource
Example - set dataSource as an existing `kendo.data.GanttDataSource` instance
Example - set dataSource as a JavaScript array
Example - set dataSource as a JavaScript object

children.description: The data source of the widget which contains the tasks. Can be a JavaScript object which represents a valid data source configuration, a JavaScript array or an existing [kendo.data.GanttDataSource](/api/javascript/data/ganttdatasource)instance.If the `dataSource` option is set to a JavaScript object or array the widget will initialize a new [kendo.data.GanttDataSource](/api/javascript/data/ganttdatasource) instance using that value as data source configuration.If the `dataSource` option is an existing [kendo.data.GanttDataSource](/api/javascript/data/ganttdatasource) instance the widget will use that instance and will **not** initialize a new one.> The Kendo UI Gantt widget can be bound *only* to a `kendo.data.GanttDataSource`. An exception will be thrown if the `dataSource` option is set to a `kendo.data.DataSource` instance.

children.name: currentTimeMarker.updateInterval
Example - set the update interval of the "current time" marker

children.description: The update interval of the "current time" marker, in milliseconds.

children.name: currentTimeMarker
children.description: If set to `false` the "current time" marker of the Gantt would not be displayed.

children.name: columns.sortable
children.description: If set to `true` the user could sort this column by clicking its header cells. By default sorting is disabled.

children.name: columns.editable
children.description: Specifies whether this column can be edited by the user.

children.name: columns.width
Example - set the column width as a number
Example - set the column width as a string

children.description: The width of the column. Numeric values are treated as pixels.

children.name: columns.format
Example - set format for the start and end column

children.description: The format that is applied to the value before it is displayed. Takes the form "{0:format}" where "format" is a [standard number format](/api/javascript/kendo#standard-number-formats),[custom number format](/api/javascript/kendo#custom-number-formats), [standard date format](/api/javascript/kendo#standard-date-formats) or a [custom date format](/api/javascript/kendo#custom-date-formats).> The [kendo.format](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-format) function is used to format the value.

children.name: columns.title
Example - set the title of a column

children.description: The text that is displayed in the column header cell. If not set the [field](#configuration-columns.field) is used.

children.name: columns.field
Example - three columns bound to the "title", "start" and "end" fields

children.description: The field to which the column is bound. The value of this field is displayed by the column during data binding.**The field name should be a valid Javascript identifier and should contain no spaces, no special characters, and the first character should be a letter.**

children.name: columns
Example - two columns bound to the "title" and "start" fields

children.description: The configuration of the Gantt columns. An array of JavaScript objects or strings. A JavaScript objects are interpreted as column configurations. Strings are interpreted as the[field](#configuration-columns.field) to which the column is bound. The Gantt will create a column for every item of the array.> If this setting is **not** specified the Gantt will create a single column for the task title.

children.name: columnResizeHandleWidth
children.description: Defines the width of the column resize handle in pixels. Apply a larger value for easier grasping.

children.name: autoBind
children.description: If set to `false` the widget will not bind to the data source during initialization. In this case data binding will occur when the [change](/api/javascript/data/datasource#events-change) event of thedata source is fired. By default the widget will bind to the data source specified in the configuration.> Setting `autoBind` to `false` is useful when multiple widgets are bound to the same data source. Disabling automatic binding ensures that the shared data source doesn't make more than one request to the remote service.

children.name: assignments.dataValueField
Example - set the assignments data value field

children.description: The field of the assignment data item which represents the amount of the assigned resource.

children.name: assignments.dataTaskIdField
Example - set the assignments data taskId field

children.description: The field of the assignment data item which represents the task id.

children.name: assignments.dataResourceIdField
Example - set the assignments data resourceId field

children.description: The field of the assignment data item which represents the resource id.

children.name: assignments.dataSource
Example - set the assignments data source

children.description: The data source which contains assignment data items.  Can be a JavaScript object which represents a valid data source configuration, a JavaScript array or an existing [kendo.data.DataSource](/api/javascript/data/datasource)instance.If the `dataSource` option is set to a JavaScript object or array the widget will initialize a new [kendo.data.DataSource](/api/javascript/data/datasource) instance using that value as data source configuration.If the `dataSource` option is an existing [kendo.data.DataSource](/api/javascript/data/datasource) instance the widget will use that instance and will **not** initialize a new one.

children.name: assignments
children.description: The configuration of the assignments of the gantt resources. An assignment is a one-to-one mapping between a gantt task and a gantt resource containing the number of units for which a resource is assigned to a task.
